name: Laurel
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2024
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
The loft is so cute! The decor is a mix and match of colors and patterns that just work together. It is a big open space that feels cozy and modern at the same time. The king bed was comfortable and we had no issues with ac/ heat either. Plenty of towels were provided. We were very satisfied!
Getting to the parking lot was a little confusing; however, it was mostly because of the major construction and road block/ road closed signs. Hannah gave us the heads up though on check in day. Thank you!
We were traveling for a friend’s wedding at Howe Farm. I will say, that drive is further than I expected, especially if the event is in the 5 Gables venue.
There are a lot of local coffee shops, restaurants and charming looking shops in walking distance to the loft. Most of which are closed on Sundays, but it was still an amusing little downtown. I would definitely revisit!

name: Greta
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
November 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: The photos and reviews are accurate: this is the most beautiful Airbnb EVER, has everything you need (except maybe cream/sugar for the espresso), and is super convenient to downtown Cleveland and Lee University. We were a little worried about the area of town but had no issues and almost no street noise. I was proud to have a couple of friends over for a take-out dinner in this stunning loft. I could totally live here! There were some burned-out lightbulbs and a few imperfections to be expected in a historic home. The only major thing renters should be aware of is that this is not exclusively an Airbnb property; that means that most of the drawers and cabinets and some of the fridge shelves are full of the owner’s belongings, and other than the list of amenities, there’s no clearly defined spaces for what’s for renters vs what’s just for the owner. Like, are spices and napkins and laundry detergent for sharing or no? My husband probably would have helped himself to the bar cart if I didn’t tell him that only the glassware was listed under amenities. It was a bit awkward to be in someone’s personal space, so I’d just want others to be aware in case they’re more accustomed to a couple of locked closets/cabinets. This does limit storage also, so I personally wouldn’t stay for more than a few nights since I’d have to live out of a suitcase, more or less. Even with this, I still give this place a five-star rating because it is truly a beautiful getaway for two people and close to everything. I’d definitely stay again if the price point remains the same.

Hannah’s loft was so amazing! It was perfectly located in town, if you’re visiting Lee University and/ or any conference held in Cleveland!
Hannah has got a style and you’ll love the decor and comfort of her loft! It has a New Orleans/French inspired vibe. It’s spacious yet cozy with thoughtful vignettes seating areas. Very unique & very beautiful! The cleanliness is impeccable as even her hard wood floors are squeaky clean!!
Hannah is a generous hostess for even supplying her guests with details like mini shampoo/conditioner body wash and TP. She has books and board games if you just want to relax.
We recommend if your visiting Cleveland, do yourself a favor and book Hannah’s loft- you’ll be in for a special treat!

12/10 highly recommend Hannah’s loft!

Hannah thought of all the creature comforts—feather pillows, extra soft linens, a Nespresso machine, and even a bottle of Prosecco. We appreciated the provided toiletries as well. Her communication was excellent and check in/check out was a breeze. I’m a local and used the space as a bridal suite for my wedding weekend, but she sent over several great recommendations of things to do and places to eat. I’m beyond pleased with my experience, and I’m tickled to have discovered this gem so close to home. We’ll be back!

Stayed with kids
review_text: What brought us to Leif's place was the incredible value. We visit our grandson and this time of year the weather can be rainy so we just need a place that is clean and where we can spread out. There are 6 of us. This was a perfect spot to do this and more. The backdrop of the private lake was wonderful even if it was rainy. We were a bit nervous because we were sharing the house with Leif, the owner, but not to worry. Leif, being a native of Cleveland, TN was very helpful, could show us how to turn on the fireplace and give us directions/suggestions of good restaurants and things to do. However, he was very busy and left the home most of the time. He was very good at letting you have the space to yourself. The beds were so comfortable, bathrooms were very nice; the master bath had a wonderful jetted tub and was so large. It was great. Overall, the BEST experience that we have had to date at an airbnb. We will be staying with Leif again.

review_text: My wife and I have stayed at Lacey‘s other locations as well. Everything was as advertised. The amenities listed in the advertisement were as expected. We needed nothing. One thing I can say about this particular home, is it is very close to Lee University, almost within walking distance, and is a great location for any families coming into town for their kids events over at the university. If you get a chance to stay at one of her locations, you will not be disappointed. And one of the biggest offerings that she has, is her locations are pet friendly. With fenced and backyards and everything. The dogs absolutely loved it. Thanks Lacey again for a wonderful stay. Jeff and Avalon.

name: Brenda
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

Group trip
review_text: When I was searching for the right place to stay in Cleveland TN, I checked several homes in the area. Thankfully I chose Laura's home Moment of Grace. Laura was a superb host, quick to reach out to me, eager to be of help with any questions before and after arrival, so gracious and kind. Upon our arrival we had no problem getting into the home. Our family traveled from Missouri to Tennessee for a weekend wedding. It was so good to have such a clean, well equipped home to relax in. Laura's home was just as described. Our party of 8 adults were on a specific schedule with one goal in mind. We had lots to do in a short time. Laura's home was so well put together, everything was clean. The layout of the home works so well. Nice clean, quiet neighborhood, easy to find. It was so serene and peaceful we really hated to leave. From the time we arrived until we left, we felt right at home. When we return to Cleveland, I will be getting another reservation for this home .

·

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: The area is perfect and the neighbors are really nice. The condition of the home upon arrival was not good and we took pictures…I considered reaching out to the owner but decided just to make the best of it. There were food crumbs on the living room end table and kitchen counters. Dried food on the fridge and handle…the dust throughout was thick and noticeable. No hand soap and the toilet paper roll was practically empty. There were instructions to remove garbage but we were greeted with a half full kitchen garbage can. The dining area table was smeared with a greasy film. My daughter and I had to wiped everything down and purchase hand soap and toilet paper. I will add on the last day we discovered a closet of supplies but nothing had been put out for us. The decor is interesting but it needs a good cleaning. The guy who cuts the grass came while we were there and that flared up my allergies…arrangements to cut grass should be made in between guest stays.

review_text: A great place. Part of the charm is Dan & Nancy. These nice folks opened their home and shared their tea with me, to help me out with my cough. The home is spacious and while they were there, it did not feel awkward. I LOVED the personal touches in the room, which were not immediately evident as meaningful, but there as tasteful decor. The comforter was great and I loved being able to listen to the sprinkle of rain, outside the big window. Very comfortable bed and internet access was easy. The neighborhood is very safe, and access to your vehicle is convenient. Dan & Nancy gave me some great local advise which proved itself. Some things close by which I appreciated: Walgreens, Ross, Starbucks, Buffalo Wild Wings! There is a little more here than expected, at this highway stop. I recommend this for any traveler.

If you are looking for a great place to stay in Cleveland, I highly encourage you stay at Dan & Nancy's place!

I thought that the cleaning people might come back to help but they didn’t offer. The hosts had a family issue which was understandable but they never offered to check in or offer anything. I was here on a work trip and me and my employees had to scrubs toilets, bathrooms, clean the refrigerator, and wash our sheets just so we could stay. The home is beautiful and the area is nice, but I was very disappointed.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This was the perfect location for exploring Cleveland and Chattanooga. Nearby parks for accessible hiking & 18 hole frisbee golf. So many restaurants nearby & groceries for eating in. We even visited the Cleveland library for some quiet moments.
It's worth the 25 minute drive down 75 to Chattanooga to see Rock City & Pointe Park. Our favorite stops downtown Chattanooga were at the National Medal of Honor Heritage Center & Sticky Fingers Rib House. Shaun's house made it all easy to get to.
This was one of the cleanest vacation rentals we've stayed in! Loved the subtle yet whimsical birds and flowers in the decor! Finding all of the birds would be a great treasure hunt for kids. The upstairs "loft" area is great for separation while still feeling connected.
The king bed had a soft mattress, but the two queen beds were firm. It's nice to find a firm option on vacation.
Shaun made us feel at home. Great communication and availability.

Rating, 4 stars

October 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Accurately described. Communication from both hosts could have been better, as I informed the host that my colleague, a registered guest would be arriving prior to my arrival. When she arrived, the check in instructions were unclear prompting an access code. She called the host and it was apparent that the information had not been communicated to both hosts regarding the different arrival times, as he was questioning who she was and stated that he only gives the codes to the primary booking guest. This was not communicated to me after I had informed the hosts of of our separate arrival times. It was after dark and my colleague mentioned that she felt a bit wary of the neighborhood in addition to not being able to enter for quite some time. I communicated this information to the host and he responded promptly and apologized. Be aware that there is a strict 10am checkout time with increasing minute by minute fees, which is quite early compared to most hosts.

review_text: Heidie went above & beyond! All the extras was awesome! The homemade cookies she provided was delicious! She provided so much to make our time away from home a lot easier on us. We stayed 7days/8 nights & we’re on the go from the time we woke up to the time we returned & not having to make a run to get something was very appreciative. Don’t think the kitchen was missing anything! Everything you could have needed was there! The coffee/tea station she has set up has so many options! Had 1 issue but she was on it pronto! Beds were comfortable & thankfully she had a fan available for white noise & a hot sleeper! For what little free time we did have she had games, coloring books, magazines & 2 streaming TV’s available for our downtime. The neighborhood was actually quieter than I thought it would be. The grandchildren loved watching the birds & squirrels in the backyard as they devoured the food in the bird feeder. 1 squirrel would get it’s food and scurry to the top, & sit & watching us!

Cookies when we arrived and breakfast the next morning after a long drive-were a God send. Almost chose Gatlinburg but our day-trip proved it would not have been a quiet place----so many people and so crowded. Cleveland and Heidie's home were a perfect "basecamp" for our daily jaunts.

Stayed with kids
review_text: After a disastrous night at a different Air bnb for the night before our wedding, we were switched to this amazing place for our mini honeymoon. To say that they went above and beyond would be an understatement!! Between the ambient lighting, the roses on the bed, the bottle of wine, and the charcuterie tray, it was the perfect touch to our wedding day. My wife actually cried when we walked in. The bed was super comfortable, and the bungalow was stocked with everything you could think of - there's a coffee bar, scents for a difusor, snacks, and a charging station, just to name a few. They also have storage bags, condiments, extra toiletries, and robes that you can use while you're there. A lot of Air bnbs are somewhat stocked, but ive never stayed anywhere that was so thoughtful in providing everything you could possibly need. To top it off, theres a therapeutic pool and hot tub! They were extremely kind to work with and very responsive. We will definitely be back and highly recommend

We also loved the private pool & hot tub and how it felt like the comfort of our own home in the "Kick-back Bungalow". Cleveland was such a nice city too and we truly enjoyed the area as it was very peaceful. It had everything you could need! We'll definitely book again and highly recommend this Airbnb to anyone looking for a relaxing stay.

My wife and I honestly consider it our getaway staycation spot, as it is right outside of Chattanooga. This was our 2nd visit to the “Kickback Bungalow” and it was even better than the first. The personal touch Beth added this time, as my wife and I were celebrating our 8th year anniversary, was very special. We were greeted with roses, flowers, key lime pie and even a special message on her chalkboard. We loved the pool and hot tub, and definitely we will be back. She even provided safety glasses for us to watch the eclipse on her nice patio. Ever since our first visit, about 2 years ago, we have told many of our friends to visit. I think we will be continuing to tell even more people about Beth’s place

Stayed with a pet
review_text: I must go on & on about Kick Back Bungalow. It is such a unique & amazing place. Very clean, well furnished & equipped & so darn beachy & cute. The pool/spa room is incredible! Imagine a boutique hotel room with your very own small private pool; hot tub, fireplace, swinging chair & more. It is so nice & relaxing after a long car ride to unwind in this private oasis. There are so many extras, gosh too many to mention them all. We especially appreciated the cold waters + juices upon arrival, wide assortment of fresh fruit + lil bagged snacks plus a Keurig coffee bar. However, the amazing white chocolate snickerdoodle type cookies decorated with chocolate seashells were out of this world! Elizabeth & Karl have done an awesome job setting this property up; it is so well organized. We travel frequently with our pup & never have we seen a vacation property that just well.....has it all! Do not hesitate to book the Bungalow; you will not regret it nor be disappointed.

review_text: 1st time writing about a property b/c Kick Back Bungalow & Elizabeth deserve it. We were welcomed by the subtle sound of Jimmy Buffet as we entered Kick Back. The space was exactly like photos & actually felt bigger especially in the indoor space. The bathroom is very compact but accurately represented in photos. I was so impressed w/personal touches added to this property-handwritten note, fruit/goodie basket, juices, coffees/teas/"fixins", meds in the cabinet, paper products a plenty, etc-difference between someone caring for their own property vs. having it managed from afar by a company was so recognizable. We were going to bring our dog but didn't & upon advising Elizabeth, she initiated a pet-fee refund proactively. The little touches from beachy tic tac toe, whimsy cabinet pulls, window picture to simulate being beachside, fairy lights, greenery all made for a great stay. I have major back issues & the therapeutic pool/hot tub were beyond words beneficial. Will be back!

Kick Back bungalow is one of those places that you want to immediately recommend to your friends and family. But, then you also don’t, because you want it to be constantly available for anytime you want to go back. 
And we really, really, really want to go back. 
We want to go back to the 19 foot spa/lap pool, and the Bluetooth speakers, and the thoughtful snacks, and the incredibly comfortable bed, and the 327 personal little touches that were everywhere you looked. The owners clearly spent a lot of time trying to think of anything and everything they could do to make you feel at home! 
The only negative thing I could say is that I’m disappointed in myself for not buying one of the robes. 
Thanks for a wonderful getaway weekend!

We felt so welcome from the minute we arrived! The kitchen is perfect for this type of stay-we planned to eat out for every meal on this trip but everything we could've needed and more was available for use in the kitchen.
The Bungalow is very tastefully decorated and comfortable! The bathroom is stocked just as well as the kitchen, including robes to lounge around in after relaxing in the hot tub or playing/exercising in the pool.
There's a cute little side porch great for hanging out in the evenings. We saw rabbits, a raccoon and lots of colorful birds. Great little breeze there.
The living area is perfect. TV is perfect size. Plenty of lights and outlets and the Bungalow offers a charging station for electronic devices.
We were very happy with our stay at the Kickback Bungalow and will definitely be back!

review_text: Kick-back bungalow was exactly as advertised and quite wonderful. It is a quiet and private situation, which was what my wife I were looking for after a hectic and difficult few months. We had a great time and unwound with long sessions in the indoor pool and hot tub, watching some streaming shows and sleeping on a very comfortable bed! There was nothing lacking and nothing that disappointed. The only criticism, and it was very minor, was the bathroom and shower are pretty small. It is very well appointed with lots of lotions and such, however. The kitchen has just about everything you might need to cook a very fine meal. If we lived close, we’d be at Kick-back bungalow several times a year! Thank you, Elizabeth, for sharing your private retreat!

review_text: My husband Carl and I spent a week at the kick back bungalow. Beth has went above and beyond to little details inside the bungalow to make it feel like you are truly in a little tropical retreat. The cold drinks and snacks upon arrival were a welcome surprise after a long drive. The coffee bar was well stocked. The swim spa/hot tub was the most fabulous part of it all, after a day out exploring the Cleveland/Chattanooga/Georgia area..it was a welcome relaxation upon return. A cold drink in the evening or sliding in in the morning with a cup of coffee... fabulous. There were actually a couple days we decided to just stay in. We actually met beth and Karl a day or so before our stay ended, and they are wonderful, kind people. It was a pleasure staying in their little slice of paradise. The only thing I think I could critique is that being one, we almost always cook our own food , and two being there for an entire week...the refrigerator is quite small...overall.. fabulous!

The only thing that came up was that the listing mentioned Disney+ as an amenity but you have to have your own subscription whereas with regard to Netflix, we had access to the host’s subscription. Beth apologized for that inconvenience and was overall super accommodating. She checked on us as we were departing to ask how our stay was. She definitely gives the impression that she wants her guests to enjoy their experience. Highly recommend!

review_text: WOW~ What can I say? AMAZING! This was our 3rd time at this beautiful oasis, or should I say heaven on earth! It is like Elisabeth goes through every foot of this home and makes each step special! From the moment you walk in, it is gorgeous! So clean, so relaxing! Easy check in and out. Great communication. Such special goodies after a long drive. Wonderful snacks. The shower is new and I was singing in it! The rain and wand on it relaxes your body but nothing compares to the jacuzzi and swim spa with fireplace and swing that you will find in the back room! After those enjoyable hours then onto a nice cup of tea (She has dif teas and coffees with all the needed creams and sugars) and popcorn to relax the evening after that heaven on earth Jimmy Buffet experience! The softest sheets imaginable and pillows~ ohhh and awwww. Wake up and have some of the best coffee and freshest fruit or cereal or the many other goodies left to only go in the spa area again and the shower because there is never enough time here to enjoy and let the worries of the world just leave your mind! I highly recommend, you won't be sorry! Perfectly clean and cozy! Heaven on earth oasis with the softest sheets, blankets, bedding, and towels. Everything you could think of is there, even a flashlight to take your dog out, now that is thoughtful! Thank you Elisabeth and family!

review_text: My wife and I are avid hikers. Cleveland is central to a ton of great hikes and waterfalls in Tennessee, Georgia and N.C. Also caverns and natural attractions. The Bungalow is awesome. Immaculate and well appointed. Elizabeth goes out of her way to make sure that one's need are met promptly. Snacks, Coffee are plentiful. Elizabeth was curious to find out in the evening to find out how are day went. I'm sure to let you guys know. She only responded to me, never did she initiate. She's definitely not the type to intrude. We kinda wish she had. We could hang with her for sure. Karl is the busy invisible man. Everything about our stay and place is positive. We were there 6 days and really didn't spend any of our daylight time there. We hike. Rigorously. The pool and hot tub allowed us to push ourselves as we knew the spa would ease our soreness, and they did. Everything works and is well supplied. Water pressure great. Soaps, towels. plates, silver, better than home. The reviewers aren't lying. Too much for the money in my view. We loved it. Kevin and Jovee

This place is just amazing, Beth is an excellent
host and receives you with bunch of things such
as snacks, fruit, plastic utensils, etc etc. Pictures
of the place cannot transmit the real feeling of
being there. I strongly recommend to visit this
place and I'll be back for sure.
Everything was clean as it can be. There is not common to find places like this with host that really care about the guests needs.
Thanks Beth!
